'''Christopher Edgerly''' ([[6 August|August 6]], [[1969]]) is an American comedian and voice actor. He was hired to replace [[Viggo Mortensen]], who had walked out because of compensation issues, in [[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (video game)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King'' (video game)]]. He went on to voice Aragorn in ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth Anthology|The Battle for Middle-earth Anthology]]'', and provided the voice of the ranger Elagost in [[Electronic Arts|EA]]'s alternative [[Fellowship of the Ring|fellowship]]-game ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age|The Third Age]]''. 

==Roles==
* [[2011]]: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: War in the North]]'' - Unspecified
* [[2010]]: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: Aragorn's Quest]]'' - Unspecified
* [[2009]]: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: Conquest]]'' - [[Aragorn]], Rohan Officer #2
* [[2006]]: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II]]'' - Aragorn, [[Éomer]], additional voices
* [[2004]]: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth]]'' - Aragorn, Éomer, additional voices
* 2004: ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Third Age]]'' - Elagost 
* [[2003]]: [[The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King (video game)|''The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King'' (video game)]] - Aragorn, [[Rohan]] soldier
